alert.note: Alert for John Day Basin (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued June 11 at 8:54PM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...HEAVY RAINFALL SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT PROMPTING RISING STREAMS AND RIVERS IN THE JOHN DAY BASIN... The combination of runoff and moderate to localized heavy rainfall over the next 24 hours will promote rising streams and rivers tomorrow into early next week. Rainfall amounts between a half inch to one inch is anticipated over the John Day Basin Sunday and Sunday night. Rises are expected on the John Day River at Service creek with the possibility of minor flood stage being reached Monday morning. Additional rises are also expected elsewhere along the John Day and nearby streams and creeks where levels may approach bankfull or rise above such as at the North Fork John Day River near Monument. Additional outlooks, including possible warnings or advisories, may be issued. Those with interests along rivers and streams should stay tuned to the forecast and stay up to date with the latest river levels.
